business.q: A sole trader must register with Companies House.
Partners in a general partnership are jointly and severally liable.
LLP must have at least two designated members.
Shareholders own the company's assets.
business.exp: The Company owns its assets (separate personality).

business.q: Pre-emption rights apply to transfer of existing shares.
business.exp: Usually applies to allotment of new shares only.

business.q: Special Resolution requires a simple majority (>50%).
Written resolutions can be used by Public Limited Companies (PLCs).
Directors must avoid conflicts of interest (s.175).
A Fixed Charge allows the company to deal with the asset freely.
Wrongful trading creates personal liability for directors.
business.exp: If insolvency ignored and loss not minimized.

business.q: Company secretary is mandatory for private companies.
PSC Register tracks People with Significant Control (>25%).
Dividends can be paid from capital.
business.exp: Must be paid from distributable profits.

business.q: Corporate Veil can be lifted for fraud.
Partnership agreement must be in writing.
business.exp: Can be oral or implied by conduct.

business.q: Directors can be removed by Ordinary Resolution.
Floating Charge crystallizes on winding up.
Preference shares usually carry voting rights.
Shadow Director is not liable for breach of duties.
business.exp: Liable as if they were a de facto director.

business.q: Substantial Property Transactions (>£100k) need shareholder approval.
Company can ratify a director's breach of duty.
Administration aim is to sell assets piecemeal.
business.exp: Primary aim is rescuing company as going concern.

business.q: Partners pay Corporation Tax on profits.
business.exp: Partners pay Income Tax on their share.

business.q: UK Companies pay Corp Tax on worldwide profits.
VAT registration is mandatory if turnover >£90k.
Insider Dealing is a civil offence only.
Money Laundering 'tipping off' is an offence.
Quorum for board meeting is always 2.
Poll vote counts: 1 member 1 vote.
Derivative Claim is brought by shareholder for the company.
Unfair Prejudice (s.994) protects minority shareholders.
Pre-incorporation contracts bind the company automatically.
Company name changed by Special Resolution.
Directors must declare interest in proposed transaction (s.177).
General Partnership is a separate legal entity.
Bribes received by fiduciary are kept in 'slush fund'.
business.exp: Held on constructive trust for principal.

business.q: Liquidators pay shareholders before creditors.
Fraudulent Trading requires proof of dishonesty.
Holding company is liable for subsidiary debts.
AGM is mandatory for private companies.
Director service contract >2 years needs approval.
Filing new director appointment: 14 days.
Connected persons include director's step-children.
Class rights variation requires 75% consent of class.
Loan to director usually needs shareholder approval.
Income Tax is payable on dividends.
BADR (Entrepreneurs Relief) reduces CGT to 10%.
Agency by estoppel arises from representation.
business.exp: Principal held out agent as having authority.

business.q: Undisclosed principal can sue on contract.
Agency terminates automatically on death.
Accounts Filing (Private): 9 months.
Accounts Filing (Public): 6 months.
Register Charge (MR01): 21 days.
Special Resolution filing: 15 days.
VAT Return deadline: 1 month 7 days.

dispute.q: Limitation Period (Contract): 6 years.
Limitation Period (Personal Injury): 3 years.
Small Claims Track limit is generally £10,000.
Overriding Objective: Deal with cases justly.
Claim Form valid for service: 4 months.
dispute.exp: Must be served within this window.

dispute.q: Default Judgment available if no Defence filed.
Part 36 offers are 'without prejudice save as to costs'.
Hearsay evidence is admissible in civil proceedings.
Small Claims costs are generally recoverable.
Injunctions are a discretionary remedy.
Summary Judgment test: 'No real prospect of success'.
Norwich Pharmacal Order identifies a wrongdoer.
Standard Disclosure requires 'reasonable search'.
Permission to appeal is usually required.
Taking Control of Goods involves bailiffs.
Pre-action protocols are optional guidance.
Particulars of Claim service: 14 days after Claim Form.
Defence (Standard) deadline: 14 days.
Tomlin Order stays proceedings on agreed terms.
Security for Costs protects the Defendant.
Fast Track value band: £10k–£25k.
Intermediate Track value band: £25k–£100k.
Case Management Conference (CMC) is for Multi-Track.
Expert evidence requires court permission.
Expert's duty is to the client paying them.
dispute.exp: Primary duty is to the Court.

dispute.q: Without Prejudice privilege hides settlement docs.
Legal Advice Privilege covers lawyer-client comms.
Litigation Privilege requires litigation in prospect.
Costs generally follow the event.
QOCS applies to breach of contract claims.
dispute.exp: Qualified One-Way Costs Shifting is for PI only.

dispute.q: Charging Order secures debt against land.
Third Party Debt Order freezes bank accounts.
Denton test applies to Relief from Sanctions.
Witness statement stands as evidence-in-chief.
Part 20 Claim includes Counterclaims.
Judicial Review is a private law remedy.
County Court hears claims >£100,000.
Service by email is permitted without indication.
dispute.exp: Must have indicated willingness to accept.

dispute.q: Unless Order carries automatic sanctions.
American Cyanamid test is for Interim Injunctions.
Freezing Injunction acts in personam.
dispute.exp: Acts on the person, not the asset.

dispute.q: Search Order requires Defendant to be absent.
dispute.exp: Must be served on Defendant to allow entry.

dispute.q: Civil Burden of Proof: Beyond reasonable doubt.
Claim 'issued' on receipt by court.
Interest is automatically 8% on all debts.
Refusing ADR can lead to cost penalties.
Skeleton arguments are oral submissions.
Precedent H is a Costs Budget.
Summary Assessment happens at 1 day hearing.
Detailed Assessment requires separate hearing.

contract.q: Consideration must be sufficient, not adequate.
Past consideration is good consideration.
Invitation to treat is an offer.
Silence can constitute acceptance.
Land contracts must be in writing (s.2 LP(MP)A).
Third parties can enforce contracts (1999 Act).
contract.exp: If named or purported to benefit.

contract.q: Hardship/Expense causes Frustration.
contract.exp: Must be impossible or radically different.

contract.q: Contract damages are compensatory.
contract.exp: Put in position as if performed.

contract.q: Specific Performance is a discretionary remedy.
Postal Rule: Acceptance effective on posting.
Excluding liability for death/negligence is void.
Contract variation needs consideration.
Promissory Estoppel is a shield, not a sword.
Terms can be implied by statute (CRA 2015).
A counter-offer kills the original offer.
Advertisements are usually offers.
Battle of forms: Last shot wins.
Social agreements are presumed binding.
Commercial agreements are presumed binding.
Minors' contracts for 'necessaries' are binding.
Misrepresentation makes a contract void.
Fraudulent Misrep damages cover all direct loss.
Duress to the person makes contract voidable.
Economic Duress requires illegitimate pressure.
Undue Influence is presumed between Husband/Wife.
contract.exp: Must be proved (not a protected class).

contract.q: Operative Mistake makes a contract void.
Non est factum means 'not my deed'.
Restraint of Trade clauses are prima facie void.
Blue Pencil test allows severance of illegal terms.
Condition is a term going to the root of contract.
Breach of Warranty allows termination.
Innominate Term: Remedies depend on consequences.
Anticipatory Breach allows immediate lawsuit.
Damages are assessed at date of breach.
Claimant has a duty to mitigate loss.
Remoteness: Hadley v Baxendale test.
Liquidated damages must be a genuine pre-estimate.
Penalty clauses are enforceable.
Quantum meruit means 'as much as earned'.
UCTA 1977 applies to consumer contracts.
CRA 2015: Goods must be of satisfactory quality.
Right to reject goods (CRA): 30 days.
Agent has a fiduciary duty to principal.
Revocation of offer must be communicated.
Revocation by post is effective on posting.
Auction bid is an offer.
Auction hammer fall is acceptance.
Tenders are usually invitations to treat.
Accord & Satisfaction settles a debt.
Privity: Contract cannot burden third party.
Cooling off (Distance Sales): 14 days.
Limitation for Deed: 12 years.

tort.q: Caparo test establishes Duty of Care.
Thin Skull Rule: Take victim as you find them.
Pure economic loss is generally recoverable.
Breach judged by reasonable person standard.
Vicarious liability applies to independent contractors.
OLA 1957 covers lawful visitors.
Truth is a complete defence to defamation.
Rylands v Fletcher imposes strict liability.
Contributory Negligence is a partial defence.
Res Ipsa Loquitur reverses burden of proof.
Private Nuisance protects enjoyment of land.
Secondary victims must witness event with own senses.
Volenti non fit injuria is a defence of consent.
Learner drivers are judged by lower standard.
Product liability (CPA 1987) is strict.
Bolam test applies to professionals.
But For test establishes factual causation.
Novus Actus Interveniens breaks chain of causation.
Wagon Mound test determines remoteness.
Employers have non-delegable duty for equipment.
OLA 1984 covers trespassers.
Warning sign always discharges duty.
tort.exp: Must enable visitor to be safe.

tort.q: Public Nuisance is both Crime & Tort.
Libel is permanent form defamation.
Slander is transient form defamation.
Honest Opinion is a defamation defence.
False Imprisonment requires total restraint.
Battery requires hostile intent.
Assault is apprehension of immediate force.
Conversion involves inconsistent dealing with goods.
Deceit involves making a false statement.
Hedley Byrne: Liability for Negligent Misstatement.
Floodgates argument limits psychiatric injury claims.
Primary victim is physically endangered.
Rescuers are treated favorably in tort.
Ex turpi causa (Illegality) is a valid defence.
Emergency situations lower standard of care.
Children judged by standard of reasonable child.
Pure psychiatric harm is not recoverable.
Loss of chance is recoverable in medical negligence.
Vicarious liability requires 'close connection'.
Nuisance claimant must have interest in land.
Prescription (20 years) is nuisance defence.
Statutory Authority is a nuisance defence.
General Damages cover Pain/Suffering.
Special Damages cover Financial Loss.
Provisional Damages allow for future deterioration.
Fatal Accidents Act allows dependents to claim.
Limitation for Defamation: 1 year.
Latent Damage Longstop: 15 years.
Egg Shell Skull Rule: Take victim as found.

landLaw.q: Legal lease >3 years must be by deed.
Curtain principle keeps trusts off register.
Easement is a right to possess land.
Positive covenants run with the land.
landLaw.exp: Burden does not run at law.

landLaw.q: Mortgage power of sale is statutory.
Exchange of contracts creates equitable interest.
Lease <7 years is an Overriding Interest.
Freehold: Fee Simple Absolute in Possession.
Only two legal estates exist in land.
Puisne mortgage is a legal mortgage.
Class F Land Charge protects spouse rights.
Doctrine of Notice applies to Registered Land.
Four Unities: Possession, Interest, Title, Time.
Trustees have powers of absolute owner.
Benefit of covenant runs at law.
Burden of covenant runs at law.
Tulk v Moxhay applies to negative covenants.
Equity of redemption is right to pay off.
First registration is compulsory on sale.

propertyPractice.q: SDLT is a tax on the seller.
Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) payment deadline is 14 days.
Root of Title must be 15 years old.
Completion date is time of essence.
propertyPractice.exp: Only if notice served or stated.

propertyPractice.q: Notice to Complete makes time of essence (10 days).

criminalLaw.q: Theft: Dishonest appropriation of property of another.
Cannot steal your own property.
criminalLaw.exp: Can if under control of another (Turner).

criminalLaw.q: Woollin Test: Virtual certainty.
Recklessness is objective.
Robbery requires a weapon.
Burglary 9(1)(b) requires intent after entry.
Self-defence is based on honest belief.
Intoxication is a defence to basic intent crimes.
Strict liability requires proof of intention.
Diminished responsibility is a defence to murder.
Duress is a defence to attempted murder.
Murder carries a mandatory life sentence.
Loss of Control requires 'qualifying trigger'.
Unlawful Act Manslaughter requires dangerous act.
Gross Negligence Manslaughter: Adomako test.
ABH (s.47) requires a wound.
GBH s.18 requires intent to cause GBH.
GBH s.20 requires intent to cause GBH.
Fraud by false rep requires gain/loss intent.
Making off without payment is s.3 Theft Act 1978.
Criminal damage can be committed recklessly.
Arson is criminal damage by fire.
Aggravated damage endangers life.
Intoxication negates mens rea.
Dutch Courage intoxication is a defence.
Necessity is a generally recognized defence.
Automatism leads to acquittal.
Insanity leads to acquittal.
Attempt requires act 'more than merely preparatory'.
Conspiracy requires agreement.
Assisting offender is a post-crime offence.

criminalPractice.q: Magistrates' Court max sentence for one offence is 12 months.
Either-way offences can be tried in Mags or Crown.
Newton Hearing determines facts after guilty plea.
Detention clock starts on arrival at station.
Superintendent can extend detention to 36 hours.
Magistrates can extend detention to 96 hours.
Right to legal advice can be delayed 36 hours.
Non-intimate samples can be taken without consent.
Video Identification (VIPER) is mandatory if ID is disputed.
PTPH (Plea & Trial Prep) is in Crown Court.
Bad Character evidence is automatically admissible.
Unfair evidence excluded under s.78 PACE.

willsAdmin.q: Taper relief applies to gifts 3-7 years before death.
Executors act from date of death.
Administrators act from date of death.
s.27 Notice protects against known creditors.
Ademption: Specific gift fails if asset gone.
Benjamin Order: Missing beneficiary presumed dead.
Donatio Mortis Causa (DMC) is deathbed gift.
Undue influence must be proved in probate.
Blind person cannot witness a will.
Abatement: Residue used first for debts.
s.33 WA 1837 saves gifts to children.
Inheritance Tax Nil Rate Band is £325,000.
Lifetime Chargeable Transfer (LCT) incurs 20% immediate tax.
Quick Succession Relief applies to deaths within 5 years.
Chain of Representation: Executor of Executor.
Adult children can claim under 1975 Act.
Spouse standard is 'reasonable in all circumstances'.

trusts.q: Three Certainties required for express trust.
Strong v Bird perfects imperfect gift.
Resulting trust arises if express trust fails.
Presumption of Advancement: Father to child.
Disposition of equitable interest needs writing.
Beneficiary of secret trust can witness will.
Re Dean: Trust for animals valid.
Standard of care: Prudent man of business.
Breach of trust liability is personal.
Hallett's Estate: Trustee spends own money first.
Duty to distribute correctly is strict.
Trust fails for want of trustee.

public.q: Parliamentary Sovereignty means Parliament can make/unmake any law.
Prerogative powers are subject to Judicial Review.
HRA 1998 allows courts to strike down legislation.
Ultra Vires means acting outside power.
Supreme Court is bound by its own decisions.
Rule of Law: No one is above the law.
Salisbury Convention: Lords won't block Manifesto bills.
Article 6 ECHR: Right to Fair Trial.
Article 8 ECHR: Private and Family Life.
Separation of Powers: Executive, Legislature, Judiciary.
Constitutional statutes are immune to implied repeal.
HRA s.2: Court must take into account Strasbourg.
HRA s.6: Public authorities must act compatibly.
Bias test: Fair minded and informed observer.
Retained EU Law has supremacy over pre-Brexit law.
Absolute rights (e.g. Torture) cannot be interfered with.
Lord Chancellor is head of Judiciary.
Jury Equity allows acquittal against evidence.
Solicitors Disciplinary Tribunal (SDT) can strike off.
Duty to Court overrides duty to client.
Stare Decisis means stand by decisions.
Statute takes precedence over Case Law.
